result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher Joseph Hayward

records.addlTxt: 10:47 AM Cases 20CM187, 20CF281, 20CM244, 20CF292, 20CM271, 20CT40, 21CF40, 21CF241, and 22CF15 called together.  Defendant Christopher Joseph Hayward in court with attorney Richard S Burris.  Defendant in custody.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Case 22CF15 on for adjourned initial appearance- DA notes that case is to be DRI as part of the agreement.  All other cases on for plea hearing.  Court reviews PLQ.  Aty Burris recites agreement, Ct 1 of 20CF281: Burglary, arm self w/dangerous weapon (PTOAC), 20CF292 Ct 1: Escape (RPTR); and 21CF40- amended Count 1 of Theft; parties to make a joint recommendation.  DA notes offer is to plead to Ct 1 of 21CF40 as charged.  DA- balance to be DRI, PSI to be requested, parties free to argue.  Atty Eugene Harrington appears by video, representing def in 22CF15- adjourned initial appearance not needed as that case is DRI; atty Harrington is excused.  Court reviews PLQ, corrects the statute as it relates to 21CF40.  Court asks def if they understand the agreement.  Def does.  Court reviews Defs constitutional rights.  Def understands that def is waiving those rights by entering into agreement today.  Court asks Def if they understand Court is not bound by agreement, and could order maximum penalties.  Def understands.  Court asks for plea.  Def enters pleas of Guilty.  Court finds def is making pleas knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily.  Court finds a factual basis to accept the pleas.  Court finds defendant guilty of Count 1 20CF292, Count 1 of 21CF281, and Count 1 of 21CF40 and orders a JOC; remaining counts and cases are DRI.  Court orders PSI, long form, agent does not need to be present, but should be available by phone- if needed- for sentencing hearing.  Bond is revoked.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on February 24, 2022 at 10:45 am.

10:42 AM Called 20CF281, 20CF292, 20CM187, 20CM244, 20CM271, 20CT40, 21CF40, 21CF241 for STC with Attny Richard S Burris who appears by video and 22CF15 for INIT with Attny Eugene D Harrington who appears in person.  Defendant, Christopher Joseph Hayward, appeared by video from the Burnett County Jail.  Attorney James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State in person.  Attny Burris updates the court on 8 STC cases, working on a global offer but hasn't received it yet.  Attny Burris would be able to take the new case too.  State would be able to send a global offer, has worked with defs past attny's but will check on most recent offer.  Court asks if offer included newest case, 22CF15.  State confirms offer would be all inclusive.  State - offer plea to count 1 in 20CF281 and count 1 in 20CF292 escape, and count 1 in 21CF40 receiving property theft, other matters DRI including 22CF15, PSI and free to argue.  DA says this is consistent to March 24 offer to prior Attny.  Court reviews plead to 3 felonies, DRI remainder, PSI and free to argue.  Attny Burris issue with escape case.  Set 20CF292 for Trial.  In 20CF292 scheduled Final Pre-Trial for February 24, 2022 at 10:45 AM and scheduled Jury Trial 12 for March 22, 2022 as #1. For case 22CF15, Attny Harrington delivered the criminal complaint to the jail but has not reviewed with def. Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 24, 2022 at 10:45 am.
